function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"The spread of contagious diseases in smart cities due to lack of effective monitoring and interpretation of health-related data.","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Innovation in pervasive sensor technologies and wireless communication protocols","category":"Innovation and adoption risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of data over radio waves","category":"Infrastructure and connectivity risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited network and database setups for smart cities","category":"Infrastructure and connectivity risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incomplete coverage of key aspects like health care, epidemiology, and frontline workers in existing covid-19 knowledge graphs","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cost effectiveness of 5g technology","category":"Infrastructure and connectivity risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Verification and validation v&v of crowd models","category":"Modeling and simulation risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate understanding of the relationship between built environments and covid-19 transmission","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistent transmission results in animal models","category":"Healthcare and medical risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of topic modeling and data analysis methods may not account for public health and disease propagation considerations in the built environment.","category":"Modeling and prediction risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Difficulty in intercepting pathogen introduction through air ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on open government technology for disaster management.","category":"Healthcare infrastructure and technology adoption risks ","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use
